alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Sussex, southwestern Kent, southeastern Queen Anne`s and Caroline Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oakland, or 10 miles east of Centerville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Denton, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Goldsboro, Queen Anne, Smithville, Jumptown, Agner, Griffin, Andrewsville, Starr, Greenwood, Hillsboro and Farmington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
